title: Russian barrage kills 25 in Ukraine as US restarts peace talks | ABC NEWS
description: Ukraine says a barrage of Russian drones and missiles has killed 25 people, including three children, in a part of the country where many from the frontline have taken shelter. The attack coincides with reports the US government is looking to revive peace talks. title: China bans seafood from Japan, calls on PM Takaichi to retract Taiwan remarks | The World | ABC News
description: Beijing has upped the ante on its diplomatic dispute with Tokyo - suspending all seafood imports form Japan. China says the move was prompted by the need to further monitor the water from Fukushima being released in the ocean. But it's being viewed as another act of retaliation by Beijing over Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi's recent remarks about triggering a military response if China invades Taiwan. Dr Jeff Hall from Kanda University of International Studies spoke to The World's Girish Sawlani about the impacts of China's sanctions on Japan's economy. #ABCTheWorld #ABCAsiaPacific  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Dozens killed in Russian strike on apartment buildings in west Ukraine | The World | ABC NEWS
description: The western Ukrainian city of Ternopil has been hit by a major Russian drone attack that killed 25 people, including several children. It comes as Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy travels to Turkiye as part of efforts to increase international pressure on Vladimir Putin. Meanwhile, a Russian spy ship has been spotted near British territory, as Moscow continues to test the boundaries of NATO and its allies. Global affairs analyst Michael Bociurkiw tells The World it's been an "unbelievable" 48 hours. description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says he is ready to work with Donald Trump after the US shared its draft plan to end the war between Russia and Ukraine. title: Albanese arrives in South Africa for the G20 summit | ABC NEWS
description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has arrived in Johannesburg for the G20 summit, where he plans to meet with South Africa's president and the president of the European Commission.  US President Donald Trump will not attend the summit—the first on African soil—citing concerns over the "persecution" of white South African farmers. title: The secret US plan to end Putin’s war | ABC News Daily podcast
description: There’s a secret US-led plan to end the war in Ukraine, but it reportedly asks a lot of the country that’s been invaded by Russia.    Media reports suggest the plan would see Ukraine would give up land, reduce the size of its army, relinquish weapons and make Russian an official state language.    At the same time, Putin’s forces have launched new strikes on Ukrainian cities and a Russian spy ship off the coast of Scotland is causing concern.    Today, Matthew Sussex, a visiting fellow at the ANU’s Centre for European Studies on why prospects for peace are looking dim.    Featured:    Matthew Sussex, visiting fellow at the Australian National University’s Centre for European Studies

title: Virgin, Qantas to ban power banks on flights after string of fires | ABC NEWS
description: Australian airlines will ban portable power banks after a string of events, including a mid-air fire on a Virgin Australia flight in July.  From December 1, Virgin Australia passengers must keep power banks visible and accessible. Qantas, QantasLink, and Jetstar will enforce similar rules starting December 15. title: Fire at COP30 nation's exhibition pavilion prompts evacuation | ABC NEWS
description: Thirteen people have been treated for smoke inhalation following a fire at the COP30 venue in Belém, Brazil. Local firefighters said the cause of the fire was being investigated, but it looked like a fault in electrical equipment, likely from a microwave. title: Cyclone warning declared for Darwin as Fina approaches | ABC NEWS
description: Senior Meteorologist Angus Hines provides an update for Tropical Cyclone Fina as it slowly approaches the Top End of the Northern Territory. Damaging winds and heavy rainfall are forecast for the northern coast of the NT, including the Tiwi Islands and West Arnhem Land. The most severe weather for Darwin is expected to begin from lunchtime on Saturday. Cyclone track maps will be updated every three hours. title: Experts support ban on power banks on planes | ABC NEWS
description: Starting December 1, passengers on Virgin Australia flights will be required to keep their power banks in sight and easily accessible throughout the flight.  Emma Sutcliffe, Director of EV Fire Safe, supports the changes, noting that Australia has experienced at least four lithium-ion battery fires on aircrafts. In the US, incidents occur about once a week, reflecting a global rise in battery-related events as more passengers travel with batteries. title: Bulk-billing rates at a standstill | ABC NEWS
description: Quarterly Medicare data shows bulk-billing is at 77.6 % which is much the same as 2024 figures. The report shows that, for the first time ever, the average out-of-pocket cost per patient exceeded $50.
